meanings.definition: A group of similar things or people positioned or occurring closely together.
meanings.sent1: In the forest, a cluster of mushrooms grew near the fallen log.
meanings.sent2: The cluster of colorful balloons floated in the sky during the parade.
meanings.sent3: The cluster of giggling children ran around the playground, playing tag.
meanings.sent4: The cluster of houses on the hillside looked like a cozy little village.
meanings.sent5: The cluster of ripe berries on the bush was a tempting sight for the hungry birds.

meanings.definition: A small group of people or things.
meanings.sent1: During the field trip, a cluster of students gathered around the tour guide.
meanings.sent2: The small cluster of houses at the end of the street formed a tight-knit community.
meanings.sent3: The cluster of colorful pencils in the pencil case made it easy to find the right one.
meanings.sent4: The cluster of kittens played together in the sunbeam, chasing their tails.
meanings.sent5: The cluster of books on the shelf belonged to the avid reader.

meanings.definition: A group of stars or galaxies.
meanings.sent1: Through the telescope, the cluster of stars in the night sky looked mesmerizing.
meanings.sent2: The astronomers studied the cluster of galaxies to understand their formation.
meanings.sent3: The cluster of twinkling stars above the campfire sparked wonder in the children's eyes.
meanings.sent4: The cluster of distant galaxies in the universe held mysteries waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: The cluster of constellations guided the sailors across the vast ocean.
